title: Tag v0.4.0 eigen submodule no longer downloads
body_html:
Issue description

When I checkout v0.4.0 and run a submodule update it can no longer find github.com/RLovelett/eigen.git

This third party repository going down probably coincided with pull request #7089

Code example

git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
git checkout v0.4.0
git submodule update --init

Output that concerns this issue

Cloning into 'third_party/eigen'...
Username for 'https://github.com': k-chaney
Password for 'https://k-chaney@github.com': 
remote: Repository not found.
fatal: repository 'https://github.com/RLovelett/eigen.git/' not found
fatal: clone of 'https://github.com/RLovelett/eigen.git' into submodule path 'third_party/eigen' failed

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): Source
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): not there yet
  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04
  • PyTorch version: v0.4.0
  • Python version: 2.7.12
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: CUDA 9.0 cuDNN 7
  • GPU models and configuration: Titan X
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): Not there yet
  • CMake version: Not there yet
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries:

body:
## Issue description

When I checkout v0.4.0 and run a submodule update it can no longer find github.com/RLovelett/eigen.git

This third party repository going down probably coincided with pull request #7089

## Code example

```
git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
git checkout v0.4.0
git submodule update --init
```

Output that concerns this issue
```
Cloning into 'third_party/eigen'...
Username for 'https://github.com': k-chaney
Password for 'https://k-chaney@github.com': 
remote: Repository not found.
fatal: repository 'https://github.com/RLovelett/eigen.git/' not found
fatal: clone of 'https://github.com/RLovelett/eigen.git' into submodule path 'third_party/eigen' failed
```

## System Info

- PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): Source
- Build command you used (if compiling from source): not there yet
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04
- PyTorch version: v0.4.0
- Python version: 2.7.12
- CUDA/cuDNN version: CUDA 9.0 cuDNN 7
- GPU models and configuration: Titan X
- GCC version (if compiling from source): Not there yet
- CMake version: Not there yet
- Versions of any other relevant libraries:
